summary: Build a paper trading app named Aurex that lets users simulate investing/trading with virtual money (no real broker integration).

existing_features.title: Create the Aurex paper trading app as a virtual investing/trading simulator (paper trading only) where users can simulate investing with virtual money and no real broker integration.
Implement authentication and per-user data isolation using Internet Identity, so each user has their own virtual cash balance, holdings, and trade history.
Frontend: Build the main Aurex UI with pages/sections for Dashboard (account summary), Trade (place buy/sell), Portfolio (positions + P/L using latest prices), and History (executed paper trades).

Frontend + Backend: Provide a simple way to manage symbol prices for the simulator (price board). If no external market data is used, allow setting/updating latest price per symbol from the app UI (restricted to the signed-in user unless an explicit admin concept is implemented).
Add an About/Branding section for the app name "Aurex" and include the provided CEO name "Harsh Gupta" as plain, user-provided branding text (no claims of verification).

Define and apply a coherent visual theme for Aurex across the UI (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) with a distinct style suitable for a trading simulator; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Aurex paper trading app so users can simulate investing/trading with virtual money (paper trading), including basic order placement flow.

Backend: Add persistent paper-trading state and APIs in the single Motoko main actor to support: user profile (virtual cash), holdings/positions per symbol, trade/order history, and a simple price board (symbol -> latest price) used for fills and portfolio valuation.

Backend: Implement paper order placement endpoints for BUY and SELL market orders for a chosen symbol and quantity, validating inputs and enforcing constraints (e.g., sufficient cash for buys, sufficient holdings for sells).

architectural_notes: App will be a paper-trading (simulation) product; no real-money broker API integrations.
